    • Method Detail

      • getAllAuthorizedPlaylist

        @GetMapping(produces={"application/json","application/xml"})
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.util.List<Playlist>> getAllAuthorizedPlaylist​(@RequestHeader(value="Authorization",required=false)
                                                                                                  java.lang.String jwt,
                                                                                                  @RequestParam("userId")
                                                                                                  java.lang.String user)
        Get a playlist by userId parameter, if userId is same as authorized user get all playlists else only public Playlists Authorization: token Accept: application/json

        Example: GET ../songsWS-MarvEn/rest/songLists?userId=mmuster

        Parameters:
        jwt - JWT Token
        user - User id of the requested playlist
        Returns:
        Playlist and http 200 if request successful

      • getPlaylistById

        @GetMapping(value="/{id}",
            produces={"application/json","application/xml"})
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Playlist> getPlaylistById​(@RequestHeader(value="Authorization",required=false)
                                                                         java.lang.String jwt,
                                                                         @PathVariable("id")
                                                                         java.lang.Integer playlistId)
        Get a Playlist by playlist Id, only if authorized user is the owner of the requested playlist or the playlist is public

        Authorization: token Accept: application/json

        Example: GET ../songsWS-MarvEn/rest/songLists/5

        Parameters:
        jwt - Jwt token
        playlistId - Id of the requested playlist
        Returns:
        requested playlist with corresponding songs

      • addPlaylist

        @PostMapping(consumes="application/json")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> addPlaylist​(@RequestHeader(value="Authorization",required=false)
                                                                             java.lang.String jwt,
                                                                             @RequestBody @Valid
                                                                             @Valid Playlist playlist)
                                                                      throws java.net.URISyntaxException
        Post a new playlist, owner of the playlist will be set to the authenticated user sending the post request

        Content-Type: application/json Headers Authorization: token

        Example: POST ../rest/songLists

        Parameters:
        jwt - Jwt
        playlist - Playlist to add
        Returns:
        Location Header with Id of the new Playlist
        Throws:
        java.net.URISyntaxException - URISyntaxException

      • updatePlaylist

        @PutMapping(value="/{id}",
            consumes="application/json")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> updatePlaylist​(@RequestHeader(value="Authorization",required=false)
                                                                                java.lang.String jwt,
                                                                                @RequestBody @Valid
                                                                                @Valid Playlist playlist,
                                                                                @PathVariable("id")
                                                                                java.lang.Integer id)
        Put a Playlist

        Content-Type: application/json Headers Authorization: token

        Example: POST ../rest/songLists/{id}

        Parameters:
        jwt - JWT Token
        playlist - updated playlist
        id - if of the playlist to update
        Returns:
        HTTP NOT_FOUND if successful

      • deletePlaylistById

        @DeleteMapping("/{id}")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> deletePlaylistById​(@RequestHeader(value="Authorization",required=false)
                                                                                    java.lang.String jwt,
                                                                                    @PathVariable("id")
                                                                                    java.lang.Integer playlistId)
        Delete a specific Playlist Only authorized owner of playlist can delete his own playlists Example: Delete ../songsWS/rest/songLists/{id}
        Parameters:
        jwt - Jwt token
        playlistId - id of playlist to be deleted
        Returns:
        HTTP NO CONTENT if playlist has been deleted, UNAUTHORIZED if not authorized, FORBIDDEN if trying to delete playlist that belongs to another user or BAD REQUEST
